results.title: The Australian littering quest
results.creator_credit: Jack Zalkalns, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A satirical look at the four contestants hopeful of winning Australia’s littering quest. Describes the various ways they do their littering - including leaving rubbish at a picnic, throwing out “throw-away litter bags”. The judge, a computer, comments on their achievements and announces the winner. Cast includes Tom Paine, Pauline David, Rod Bryer, Guy Doro-Sainter, Monika Tokarski, Ema Ganet.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 043. Three Directions in Pop Music
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Offers a sample of three trends in recent Australian pop music: the theatrical act of Wendy Saddington and Teardrop; the jug music of the Captain Matchbox Whoopee Band; and the popular rock group Indelible Murtceps.
results.title_for_label: Australian [colour] diary. No. 043. Three Directions in Pop Music

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 027
results.brief_description: This cinemagazine shows the ceremonial opening of Macquarie University in Sydney. A new pattern of study will enable students to participate in a variety of subjects in different faculties. Kathleen Geldard, member of the Australian Ballet Company describes her life of travel, rehearsals and performances.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 026
results.brief_description: Sydney artists Geoff Pike and Bob Booth exhibit their paintings on a floating gallery, the “One Step”, and profits from sales are to finance further their voyage around the Pacific Islands. Also featured is the launching of the Blue Streak Rocket from Woomera, the holiday resort of Forster on the New South Wales coast with its history, scenic surroundings and facilities.

results.title: Aucassin and Nicolette
results.creator_credit: Lotte Reiniger, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated medieval fantasy, a delightful silhouette film, with colour background by master German animator Lotte Reiniger. Set against a background of castles and forest with Renaissance style music this enchanting tale recounts the love story of Aucassin and Nicolette.

results.title: Atomic energy explained
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: A practical outline of atomic energy and its peaceful applications. Studies the structure of atomic particles and shows how energy can be released from them to produce atomic power. Also illustrates how radio-isotopes are being put to valuable use in modern industry and medicine. No other credits available.

results.title: At whose door
results.creator_credit: Max Anderson, Leon Clore and Basic Films
results.brief_description: This film deals with the problems of accident prevention in the British iron and steel industry. Demonstrates that accidents do not merely happen- they are caused, not always by one individual or one mistake but by a combination of circumstances which could have been foreseen. Illustrations include: faulty handling of materials or tools, falling or knocking against equipment, untidy workshops, bad stacking or storing, neglect and carelessness.

results.title: Assignment P.6.
results.brief_description: An account the evolution of the Rover Company’s P.6. car - later known as the Rover 2000 - from the initial plans to the first production line models three years later. No other credits available.
